meanings.definition: A person who makes or enacts laws.
meanings.sent1: The lawgivers in our country work hard to create fair rules for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The lawgivers gathered in the parliament to discuss new regulations.
meanings.sent3: The lawgivers decided to have a pizza party to brainstorm new laws.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nature, bees can be seen as the lawgivers of the hive.
meanings.sent5: The wise lawgivers of ancient times were respected for their knowledge and fairness.

meanings.definition: A group of people who make or enact laws.
meanings.sent1: The lawgivers in the council debated the proposed changes to the legal system.
meanings.sent2: The lawgivers from different regions came together to form a unified code of conduct.
meanings.sent3: The lawgivers organized a costume party to celebrate the passing of new laws.
meanings.sent4: The lawgivers of history left a lasting legacy of justice and order.
meanings.sent5: The lawgivers of the land met under the ancient oak tree to draft new statutes.
